Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and black in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394590) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394590)
